Participants.evidence: This study included patients with AKI diagnosed within 4 days after CABG during the period January 2016 to December 2020.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were divided into BNP and non-BNP groups according to whether rh-BNP was injected intravenously after the operation.

Objective.evidence: This study sought to explore the efficacy of rh-BNP in patients with AKI after bypass surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The decreasing trend of postoperative serum creatinine levels (P<0.001) and postoperative urine volume (P=0.001) within 4 days of surgery were independent associated with rh-BNP.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 395 patients, including 56 and 339 patients in the BNP and non-BNP groups, respectively, were included in this study.

Number_Analysed.evidence: From PSM, 175 patients, including 44 and 131 patients in the BNP and non-BNP groups, respectively, were included in this study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The decreasing trend of postoperative serum creatinine levels in the BNP group was significantly stronger than that in the non-BNP group (0.04±0.28 vs. −0.16±0.36, P=0.001).
